item.title: Writing UpdatesMasks
item.dc:creator: @iz3_legend iz3 legend
item.description:
@iz3_legend wrote:

I have the majority of a player updating system done minus appearance updating, i’m currently stumped at trying to write the update masks to game client. When I write the mask it immediately backs out of the visible world but holds the connection steady. I’m writing it as a Little-Endian-Short if the update mask is greater than X and a signed byte if the mask is less than X. I’ve also tried writing them both as other similar data types but it all results in the same effect.

 int playerUpdateMask = 0x0;
	    if (player.isUpdateRequired()) {
		if (player.isAppearanceUpdateRequired()) {
		    playerUpdateMask |= 0x10;
		}
		if (playerUpdateMask >= 0x100) {
		    playerUpdateMask |= 0x40;
		    builder.writeLittleEndianShort(playerUpdateMask);
		} else {
		    builder.writeByte((byte) playerUpdateMask);
		}

I debugged the process and it performs perfectly fine when the masks aren’t sent so i’m positive it’s them. Does anyone have an idea what’s causing this? My client prints out this message:

Error: mopar to many players
Error: T2 - 81,73,71 - 6,3152,3152 - 1,16,-128,7,-1,0

I’m not entirely sure why it says this since what i’m writing has no correlation with the amount of players in the virtual world. I’m sorry if this is the wrong section for this but I read the sectional rules and I don’t think that it is. My networking system is the latest release of netty.

Read full topic
